dn16:3.50.4.pli: Katame ca te, bhikkhave, dhammā mayā abhiññā desitā, ye vo sādhukaṁ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
dn16:3.50.4.en: And what are those things I have taught from my direct knowledge?

dn16:3.51.1.pli: Ime kho te, bhikkhave, dhammā mayā abhiññā desitā, ye vo sādhukaṁ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
dn16:3.51.1.en: These are the things I have taught from my direct knowledge. Having carefully memorized them, you should cultivate, develop, and make much of them so that this spiritual practice may last for a long time. That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 16
The Great Discourse on the Buddha’s Extinguishment

mn103:3.1.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ye vo mayā dhammā abhiññā desitā, seyyathidaṁ—
mn103:3.1.en: In that case, each and every one of you should train in the things I have taught from my direct knowledge, that is:

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 103
Is This What You Think Of Me?

mn104:5.2.pli: ye vo mayā dhammā abhiññā desitā, seyyathidaṁ—
mn104:5.2.en: Do you see even two mendicants who disagree regarding the things I have taught from my direct knowledge, that is,

dn29:17.2.pli: Katame ca te, cunda, dhammā mayā abhiññā desitā, yattha sabbeheva saṅgamma samāgamma atthena atthaṁ byañjanena byañjanaṁ saṅgāyitabbaṁ na vivaditabbaṁ, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ?
dn29:17.2.en: And what are those things I have taught from my direct knowledge?
